meanings.definition: Excessive or insincere praise or compliments.
meanings.sent1: She saw through his flatteries and knew he was not being honest.
meanings.sent2: The singer was tired of the constant flatteries from her fans.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to enjoy the flatteries of the birds outside the window.
meanings.sent4: His flatteries were like empty balloons, shiny but hollow inside.
meanings.sent5: The flatteries of the salesman were as transparent as glass, revealing his true intentions.

meanings.definition: The act of flattering or trying to please someone through praise or compliments.
meanings.sent1: Her flatteries towards her boss were obvious to everyone in the office.
meanings.sent2: He used flatteries to get on the good side of his classmates.
meanings.sent3: The dog's flatteries towards its owner involved wagging its tail vigorously.
meanings.sent4: In the world of politics, flatteries are often used to gain favor and support.
meanings.sent5: The flatteries of the chef's delicious dishes made the customers feel special and appreciated.
